Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured small pottery kantharos; interior: glazed black with added red band; exterior: red band at rim; black-figure decoration consisting of part of frontal chariot; right pole horse’s neck, with red on mane, turned to right; head of bearded male charioteer with red on face, to left; inscription in field.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: The sherd joins Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.131.1894.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.14)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 258, no. 14)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 354, no. B449)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 6 (b))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0734) (Phase 1)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 35)
